I didn’t want to relive this memory yesterday. I felt too sad. But my brief encounter with Mtume will stick with me forever. Thinking of those he loved and those that loved him 🌺

We talked about the neighborhood, The East, jazz in central Brooklyn, New York Undercover, and his relationship to hip hop. Mtume was so special to me because he didn’t shy away from the youth of his day. He embraced them, both as a musician and through his involvement in TV.

I was playing a song from my fav Miles record on the station, Get Up With It, and I see Mtume’s face change. He says something nostalgic like, “The memories...” I ask him what his favorite memory was and he says, “Playing!”

I met Mtume in Bed-Stuy during a project w/ Weeksville Heritage Center, Creative Time, and Otabenga Jones & Associates. I ran a radio station out of a cut in half pink Cadillac w/ my friend Salome. Someone was supposed to interview Mtume and never showed up so I had to fill in.

@TheRevAl @jamesmtumelive Let's remember not only James Mtume was famous for "Juicy Fruit" which was sampled God knows how many times, but he scored the music for the TV show "New York Undercover"from the late 90's which changed the game. So I hope Hollywood remembers that.

2022 is already starting off rough with another loss to the music community as R&B and Jazz musician James Mtume unfortunately passed at the age of 76. He is most known for his 1983 hit “Juicy Fruit” which has been sampled numerous times 🙏🏾

mzito wa mwendo juu ya Abubakar,

«فَقَالَ لَهُ النَّبِيُّ ﷺ بِعْنِيهِ، فَقَالَ عُمَرُ: هُوَ لَكَ فَاشْتَرَاهُ ثُمَّ قَالَ: هُوَ لَكَ يَا عَبْدَ اللَّهِ بْنَ عُمَرَ، فَاصْنَعْ بِهِ مَا شِئْتَ»

“Mtume (saw) akamwambia: niuzie mimi, Umar akamjibu: sawa ni wako, basi akamnunua,

hadith ilipokewa na ibn Majah:

«أَنَّ النَّبِيَّ ﷺ نَهَى عَنْ شِرَاءِ الصَّدَقَاتِ حَتَّى تُقْبَضَ» “Kwamba Mtume (saw) amekataza kununua sadaka hadi zitakapokabidhiwa kwa wenyewe”. Na kwa hadith ilipokewa na Al-Baihaqi kutoka kwa ibn Abbas, alisema, kwamba pindi Mtume (saw)

kwa hadith ilipokewa na Abu Daud:

«أَنَّ النَّبِيَّ ﷺ نَهَى عَنْ أَنْ تُبَاعَ السِّلَعُ حَيْثُ تُبْتَاعُ، حَتَّى يَحُوزَهَا التُّجَّارُ إِلَى رِحَالِهِمْ»

“Kwamba Mtume (saw) amekataza bidhaa zisiuzwe hadi pale wafanyibiashara watakapokabidhiwa kwenye makazi yao”. Na kwa

hadi pale atakapokabidhiwa, kwani [bila hivyo] hukmu yake itakuwa ni ya kuuza kitu usichomiliki. Kwa kauli yake Mtume (saw): «مَنْ ابْتَاعَ طَعَاماً فَلَا يَبِعْهُ حَتَّى يَسْتَوْفِيَهُ» “Yeyote atakayenunua chakula basi asikiuze hadi atakapokabidhiwa” (Imepokewa na Bukhari) na

(Imepokewa na Abu Daud)

Tamko la Mtume aliposema “usichokuwa nacho” ni “jumla” linaenea, hivyo inaingia chini yake kitu chochote kisichokuwa katika umiliki wako, na pia usichoweza kukabidhi, na vilevile kitu ambacho hukijamiliki kikamilifu. Na hayo yanatiliwa nguvu na hadithi

akitaka nimuuzie nisichokuwa nacho, kisha mimi hukinunua kutoka sokoni” akajibu: “Usiuze kitu usichokuwa nacho” (Imepokewa na Ahmad)

Na imepokewa kutoka kwa Amr bin Shuaib, kutoka kwa babu yake, akisema: amesema Mtume wa Mwenyezi Mungu (saw):

amekinunua lakini hajakimiliki kikamilifu… kama hajakabidhiwa, basi itakuwa haiwezi kufungiwa mkataba wa uuzaji. Kwa kuwa hakijapatikana kitu ambacho kitafungiwa mkataba wa uuzaji kisheria. Kwa hakika amekataza Mtume wa Mwenyezi Mungu (saw) mtu kuuza kitu asichokimiliki.

alipata dirham 20 kwa mujibu wa riwaya.....

"Hivi si ni bora zaidi....

"Nusu nyingine katafute jembe na kamba uende msituni ukatafute kuni...
"Uniletee unionyeshe.."

Akaenda akachukua kuni akamletea.

Mtume (saw) akamwambia:
"Basi endelea wiki nzima....
"kila siku uuze kuni....
"kisha unipe khabari baada ya wiki..."
......

mbili.........

mpaka ikafika bei ya kisawasawa...

mtume(saw) akamwambia:
"nimekuuzia nguo yako"

"umekubali"

akajibu:
"nimekubali"

mtume (saw) akamwambia:
"chukua pesa, nusu katengeze chakula ule leo na kesho....

mtume (saw) akamwambia: 
"nguo moja vaa, moja niletee mimi"

akamletea nguo mtume (saw)...

kisha akawauliza maswahaba:
"nani atainunua hii nguo?"

mmoja akainuka akasema:

mtume (saw) akamwambia:
"hiyo kidogo"

mwengine akataka inunua kwa dirham

Pour la mettre en lumière, je ne pouvais faire l'impasse sur le groupe funk qu'il fonda à la fin des années 70 : MTUME. Et sur l'album emblématique du collectif "Juicy fruit" publié en 83 sur le label Epic. #GalettedelaSemaine https://t.co/IE6plyJK0g
Un multi-instrumentiste à la carrière passionnante. Très actif pendant les 70's, aux côtés de Miles (période "On the Corner"), Mtume a une carrière solo également très solide.
Natif de Philadelphie, fils du saxophoniste Jimmy Heath, James Forman, rebaptisé plus tard James Mtume a donc quitté la grande scène du monde le 9 janvier dernier.

@AtBestIsKorny For some reason Mtume consistently refused to license Alkebu-Lan. I know cos a friend tried several times. So the only 'reissues' are bootlegs. Copyright in Strata East recordings rest with the artists not the label. So now, I guess it's down to his family.

In 1972, James Mtume made his recording debut as a leader with “Alkebu-Lan: Land of the Blacksk” which opened with a spoken manifesto that praised “the role of Black music as a functional organ in the struggle for national liberation.” https://t.co/n6gkEASMVR
